text: I got the same error, also with react-transition-group. My solution was to extend webpack config to remove comments from the .js-file before HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin uploads the file.
We have a beta that changes how JS are handled so they are not interpreted as HubL. <@U6W3H6YN8> can enable the feature for you if you're interested.
Yep! Feel free to DM me if you are interested in this beta functionality - it will treat newly created JavaScript files as true JavaScript files (no support for HubL)

Thanks so much for all the help <@U22VBL87M> <@U6W3H6YN8> <@U013DLRAAUW>! Can you point me to a page that has all the requirements for javascript bundles? The solution <@U013DLRAAUW> had worked great but I'm running into a new error now. I would love to try to get this running without the beta feature because I'm developing it on my HubSpot account for now but I'll be handing it off to another HubSpot account when I get it working locally!

I think I might be at the root of my issues but now I keep running into
```<e> [HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin] Uploading cms-react-boilerplate/main.js failed
<e> [HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin] Error validating template.
<e> [HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin] line 0: Coded files must be smaller than 1.5 MiB```
I can't find a lot of documentation on the HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin online. Have you guys run in this before?

Hi, when I use the `hs fetch` command the `path` attribute in the json for some templates point to some global group in the form of `"path" : "generated_global_groups/6160728536.html`. However, these paths seem to be incorrect (that file doesn't exist). As such, when I upload these files into the design manager of another site (eg. my dev sandbox), I get errors saying the component has been disconnected and the file can't be found. I know the global group does exist elsewhere though. Has anyone experienced something similar? Thanks in advance!
It seems that those path numbers are for the prod site, but on the dev site the ID of the templates seem to be changed, which is causing the issue.
